question:
The Rajasthan state has launched the Ayushman Bharat-Mahatma Gandhi Rajasthan Swasthya Bima Yojna (AB-MGRSBY) scheme. In this context, consider the following statements:
  1. The people covered under the National Food Security Acts are eligible for the scheme.
  2. The scheme covers only general diseases.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: The Ayushman Bharat-Mahatma Gandhi Rajasthan Swasthya Bima Yojna (AB-MGRSBY) was launched by merging the Bhamashah Health Insurance Scheme (BSBY) and Ayushman Bharat- Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojna Scheme (AB-PMJAY). This scheme is to cover 1.1 crore families in the state. Rajasthan’s natives would be able to avail its benefits if covered under any of the national acts for food security. The eligibility will be based on socio-economic caste census of 2011. Statement 2 is incorrect: The scheme will cover both general and serious illnesses’ treatment. The scheme will provide 30,000 INR and 3 lakh INR assistance for this respectively. It also provides for cashless treatment for the beneficiaries. The eligible families must possess the Bhamashah card which can be obtained through the government’s e-governance platform called e-Mitra.
